item.title: [Gut Microbiota] Social activity alters gut microbiomes
item.creator: Philip Yeagle
item.description: Social behavior affects which bacterial species populate the gut microbiome in primate societies. Moeller et al. combined thousands of hours of behavioral observation of the – [Read More]

item.title: [Gene Editing] Editing can help build stronger muscles
item.creator: Paula A. Kiberstis
item.description: Much of the controversy surrounding the gene-editing technology called CRISPR/Cas9 centers on the ethics of germline editing of human embryos to correct disease-causing mutations. For – [Read More]
item.subject: Gene Editing

item.title: [Radio Astronomy] Identifying live radio scattering events
item.creator: Keith T. Smith
item.description: Radio emissions from distant quasars are occasionally modified for a few weeks by foreground interstellar plasma, in an extreme scattering event (ESE). Understanding this process has – [Read More]
item.subject: Radio Astronomy

item.title: [Molecular Frameworks] Weaving organic threads
item.creator: Phil Szuromi
item.description: Woven fabrics are inherently flexible. Liu et al. created a molecular fabric analog using metal-organic frameworks (see the Perspective by Gutierrez-Puebla). Phenanthroline – [Read More]
item.subject: Molecular Frameworks

item.title: [Photophysics] A different way to put triplets in play
item.creator: Jake Yeston
item.description: Most molecules adopt a singlet spin configuration: All their electrons are arranged in pairs. Unpaired triplet states engage in a variety of useful reactions but are hard to produce. – [Read More]
item.subject: Photophysics

item.title: [Geochemistry] New crustal clues from old rocks
item.creator: Brent Grocholski
item.description: The ghost of continental crust long eroded away may exist in certain element ratios found in Archean rocks. Tang et al. used Ni/Co and Cr/Zn ratios as a proxy for the magnesium – [Read More]
item.subject: Geochemistry

item.title: [Vascular Biology] Raising blood pressure with age
item.creator: Wei Wong
item.description: Hypertrophy of vascular smooth muscle cells increases blood pressure. The activation of angiotensin AT1 receptors in vascular smooth muscle cells by angiotensin II can trigger either – [Read More]
item.subject: Vascular Biology

item.title: [Comparative Behavior] Let me comfort you
item.creator: Sacha Vignieri
item.description: Consolation behavior promotes stress reduction of one by another. We know that consolation occurs in humans and apes. Burkett et al. observed that within a pair of monogamous – [Read More]

item.title: [Neurodevelopment] Neuronal migrations follow vascular pathways
item.creator: Pamela J. Hines
item.description: In the developing brain, various types of cells migrate from their birthplaces to their workplaces. Oligodendrocyte precursors, which develop to form the insulating sheaths that make – [Read More]

item.title: [Solar Energy] Relying more on the Sun
item.creator: Phil Szuromi
item.description: Improved technologies for harnessing solar energy are not limited to creating more efficient solar cells. The associated hardware of delivering power from solar cells to homes and businesses, – [Read More]

item.title: [Applied Optics] Timing on a chip
item.creator: Ian S. Osborne
item.description: Laser-induced optical frequency combs allow precision measurements and affect a broad range of technologies. Brasch et al. generated optical frequency combs on an optical chip – [Read More]

item.title: [Electrochemisty] The right kind of dopant

item.description: The oxygen reduction reaction is an important step in fuel cells and other electrochemical processes but is still largely dependent on precious metal-containing catalysts. Recently – [Read More]

item.title: [Plant Development] Cell death establishes a site for development
item.creator: Pamela J. Hines
item.description: As plant roots grow through the soil, lateral roots emerge to reach more resources. Xuan et al. now show that programmed cell death sets the course for lateral root development. – [Read More]

item.title: [Pollinator Diversity] More-diverse pollinators improve crop yields
item.creator: Sacha Vignieri
item.description: It is known that increased pollinator diversity can improve the yield of agricultural crops. However, how best to both produce food and maintain diversity is still debated. Garibaldi – [Read More]
item.subject: Pollinator Diversity

item.title: [Small RNAs] Offspring affected by sperm small RNAs
item.creator: Beverly A. Purnell
item.description: Paternal dietary conditions in mammals influence the metabolic phenotypes of offspring. Although prior work suggests the involvement of epigenetic pathways, the mechanisms remains unclear. – [Read More]

item.description: Bacteria play key roles in the global nitrogen cycle; for example, by converting ammonia (NH 3 ) to nitrate (NO 4 − ). This conversion is typically performed b – [Read More]

item.title: [Medical Genomics] Share trumps rare
item.creator: Kelly LaMarco
item.description: No longer just buzz words, “patient empowerment” and “data sharing” are enabling breakthrough research on rare genetic diseases. Although more than 100,000 genetic variants are bel – [Read More]
